title.narrative: Cyclone Idai Response Appeal Project DAPP

description.narrative: A) Vulnerable households have reduced their susceptibility to the impact of disasters through improved livelihood activities that increase household income B) Livelihood groups from disaster-affected communities have access to unconditional grants to allow them take advantage of economic opportunities C) Households have knowledge, skills and resources in early warning systems to deal with disaster risks Communities will be oriented in early warning systems and communication mechanisms. Communities will also be trained on how to make small scale flood mechanisms on rivers. This will ensure that flood mitigation measures are undertaken at community level and communities have knowledge on these flood mitigation measures. D) Target communities have access to safe, secure and user-friendly feedback and complaints mechanisms and able to get responses.

The goal of the CA Appeal is to reduce vulnerability to the impact of disasters among flood-affected households in Chikwawa and Nsanje by strengthening disaster risk management systems and enhancing livelihoods a) 2,000 farming households organised into irrigation schemes. Two solar-powered irrigation sites will be rehabilitated b) The 2,000 farming households will be targeted with integrated agriculture-aquaculture farming. c) 400 vulnerable households will be supported with small livestock production like goats. d) The project will facilitate linkages to high price markets for the crops, fish and livestock by the farmers. e) 100 young people aged 15-24 and 50 people with disability will be placed on an apprenticeship programme to train them in various vocational skills f) Targeted farming households, young people and people with disability will have access to grants for non-agricultural livelihoods so that they can be empowered economically g) Communities will be oriented in early warning systems and communication mechanisms h) Train Christian Aid, partner, government staff and community leaders and structures in safeguarding and accountability i) Target communities have access to information and materials for COVID-
